extraction_metadata.indication: treatment of patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma

AT.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma

PICOs.Population: patients with Child-Pugh stage A and BC or CLC HCC, distant metastases, or tumour metastasis that cannot be locally controlled or resected
patients with hepatic function (Child-Pugh Stage A), with distant metastases and/ or a tumour localization that cannot be locally controlled or resected
PICOs.Comparator: combination with the anti-perspirant therapy against PDLA1 and VEGF1

PICOs.Population: patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma
patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma

PICOs.Population: patients with unresectable HCC
patients with unresectable HCC
patients with unresectable HCC
patients with unresectable HCC
patients with unresectable HCC

DE.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma

PICOs.Population: patients with Child-Pugh stage A and BC or CLC HCC, distant metastases, or tumour metastasis that cannot be locally controlled or resected
patients with hepatic function (Child-Pugh Stage A), with distant metastases and/ or a tumour localization that cannot be locally controlled or resected
PICOs.Comparator: combination with the anti-perspirant therapy against PDLA1 and VEGF1

DK.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma

PICOs.Population: patients with preserved hepatic function and in good general condition where resection, transplantation, ablation or TACE/ SIRT cannot be performed or are not expected to have an effect, or for patients with additional hepatic disease
patients in good performance with good liver function
patients in good performance with good liver function
patients in good performance with good liver function
patients in good performance with good liver function
patients in good performance with good liver function

ES.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma

PICOs.Population: patients with advanced disease, systemic treatment should be offered to patients with ECOG/PS 0-1 and Child–Pugh class A

EU.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma

patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma
patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma

patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma who progressed on sorafenib treatment

IT.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma

NL.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma

PICOs.Population: patients with (not locally treatable) HCC

PO.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma

PICOs.Population: patients with non-surgical hepatocellular carcinoma in good general condition and with good liver function (Child and Pugha Class A)
patients previously treated with Sorafenib with AFP ≥ 400 ng/ ml
patients who are well tolerant of sorafenib
second-line patients who have previously received bevacizumab with atezolizumab
second-line patients who have previously received bevacizumab with atezolizumab
second-line patients who have previously received bevacizumab with atezolizumab

SE.Indication: treatment of patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma

PICOs.Population: advanced HCC, such as metastasis or malignancy, taking into account overall cardiac function, liver disease and co-morbidity
